description: 2p twin peaks: a(n) = least x with lpf(x) = lpf(x + 2p) = p = prime(n) and lpf(y) < p for all x < y < x + 2p, where lpf = least prime factor.
comments: For prime p, a 2p-twin peak is a number x such that lpf(x) = lpf(x+2p) = p and x < y < x+2p => lpf(y) < p. (lpf(n) = least prime factor of n). p = 71 is the smallest prime admitting a 2p-twin peak.
references: Various postings to math-fun mailing list, 1996-1997.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Twin peaks
formula: a(n) < A002110(n)/2, since if (x,x+2p) is a 2p-twin peak, then so is (q-x-2p,q-x), where q=A034386(p). - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 28 2014
author: _David W. Wilson_
